intro: Cremastosperma alticola, commonly known as the highland morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of South America. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its climbing habit and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous regions with cool climates. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain environments.
